flixel.util.FlxRandom

type
class
A class containing a set of functions for randomnly generating numbers or other random things.

Static Variables

MAX_RANGE(inline,null) : Int

Maximum value returned by FlxRandom.intRanged and FlxRandom.floatRanged by default.

globalSeed : Float

The global random number generator seed (for deterministic behavior in recordings and saves).

Static Methods

chanceRoll(?chance : Int) : Bool

parameters
chance The chance of receiving the value. Should be given as a uint between 0 and 100 (effectively 0% to 100%)
returns
true if the roll passed, or false
Generate a random boolean result based on the chance value Returns true or false based on the chance value (default 50%). For example if you wanted a player to have a 30% chance of getting a bonus, call chanceRoll(30) - true means the chance passed, false means it failed.

inline color(?min : Int, ?max : Int, ?alpha : Int) : Int

parameters
min The lowest value to use for the color
max The highest value to use for the color
alpha The alpha value of the returning color (default 255 = fully opaque)
returns
32-bit color value with alpha
Returns a random color value between black and white

Set the min value to start each channel from the given offset.

Set the max value to restrict the maximum color used per channel

inline float() : Float

returns
A Number between 0 and 1.
Generates a random number. Deterministic, meaning safe to use if you want to record replays in random environments.

floatRanged(?min : Float, ?max : Float) : Float

parameters
min The lowest value to return (default: 0)
max The highest value to return (default: MAX_RANGE)
returns
A pseudo random value between min (or 0) and max (or MAX_RANGE, inclusive)
Generate a random float (number) If called without the optional min, max arguments rand() returns a peudo-random float between 0 and MAX_RANGE(). If you want a random number between 5 and 15, for example, (inclusive) use rand(5, 15) Parameter order is insignificant, the return will always be between the lowest and highest value.

int() : Int

returns
A pseudo random value between 0 and 65536 inclusive.
Generates a small random number between 0 and 65535 very quickly Generates a small random number between 0 and 65535 using an extremely fast cyclical generator, with an even spread of numbers. After the 65536th call to this function the value resets.

intRanged(?Min : Int, ?Max : Int, ?Excludes : Array<Int>) : Int

parameters
Min The lowest value to return (default: 0)
Max The highest value to return (default: MAX_RANGE)
Excludes An Array of integers that will NOT be returned (default: null)
returns
A pseudo-random value between min (or 0) and max (or MAX_RANGE, inclusive)
Generate a random integer If called without the optional min, max arguments rand() returns a peudo-random integer between 0 and MAX_RANGE. If you want a random number between 5 and 15, for example, (inclusive) use rand(5, 15) Parameter order is insignificant, the return will always be between the lowest and highest value.

inline sign() : Float

returns
1 or -1
Randomly returns either a 1 or -1

inline srand(Seed : Float) : Float

parameters
Seed A number between 0 and 1, used to generate a predictable random number (very optional).
returns
A Number between 0 and 1.
Generates a random number based on the seed provided.
